alert.note: Alert for Western Highland (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 11 at 3:25PM EST until March 13 at 1:00AM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 1 AM SATURDAY TO 1 AM EST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches. Northwest winds will gust around 45 to 55 mph, especially Saturday afternoon into Saturday night. * WHERE...Locations along and west of the Allegheny Front in Maryland and West Virginia as well as western Highland County in Virginia. * WHEN...From 1 AM Saturday to 1 AM EST Sunday. Rain will change to snow between 1 and 3 AM early Saturday morning for most areas. Snow will continue through Saturday morning. Snow may taper off for a period around midday, but additional snow showers are expected Saturday afternoon into Saturday night. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. The cold wind chills as low as 15 below zero could result in hypothermia if precautions are not taken. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The combination of snow and blowing snow may reduce visibility below one-quarter mile at time. Near blizzard conditions are possible.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. When venturing outside, watch your first few steps taken on steps, sidewalks, and driveways, which could be icy and slippery, increasing your risk of a fall and injury.
